did.abstract: This collection primarily consists of handwritten copies of two specifications booklets, "Specifications for the Mason Work and Materials" and "Specifications for the Carpenter Work and Materials," as well as a small black-and-white photograph of a house built for John J. Merritt in Brooklyn Heights.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John J. Merritt house collection, 1985.058, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection primarily consists of handwritten copies of two specifications booklets, "Specifications for the Mason Work and Materials" and "Specifications for the Carpenter Work and Materials," as well as a small black-and-white photograph of a house built for John J. Merritt. John J. Merritt's house was located on the corner of Columbia Heights and Orange Street in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
